p.a: SCES, located in Wyoming, IL, serves children from preschool through 5th grade.
SCJH located in Toulon, IL, serves children from 6th through 8th grade.
SCHS located in Toulon, IL, serves children from 9th through 12th grade.
Stark County CUSD #100 is 242 square miles
Student to teacher ratio at Stark County Elementary is 15:1

div.p: 4/15/20 – Parents – Please complete this survey for each of your students on our current eLearning effort >> SURVEY LINK
3/21/20 “All of our schools and playgrounds are closed, but personnel will be remotely checking for voicemails if you need to reach staff.”
For technical issues with student Chromebooks, contact Mr. Heinold at IT@stark100.com

p.a: 3/13/20 Letter to students, staff, and community.

h3.span: Our architect recently presented the School Board with three design proposals to upgrade the Toulon campus. Click this link to see the designs. Master Plan for Toulon Campus

div.p: Our district is made up of 727 attending three schools Stark County Elementary, Stark County Junior High and Stark County High School.

div.class: cff-item cff-status-post cff-box cff-shadow author-stark-county-cusd-100 cff-322676618110440 cff-new

p.span:
SC Families:
This Thursday, April 30th from 2-6 pm, we are doing a material distribution/collection at both Toulon and Wyoming campuses. Both campuses will have instructional materials, medications and musical shirts available for pick-up.
At SCES, we will have a drive-thru distribution set up. Teachers have collected all of students' belongings and will have those ready for you to collect. We will also have May learning materials, elementary yearbooks, medication, and musical shirts. Spring photos have not come in yet. As with other drop-offs, you can return library books, completed materials, and anything else that needs to come to the school.
If you are unable to attend Thursday, we will be in touch with you to set up a time to collect your child's belongings.

div.p: When will high school students be able to clear out their lockers?
When are the jr high students getting their year books

div.class: cff-item cff-status-post cff-box cff-shadow author-stark-county-cusd-100 cff-322676618110440 cff-new

p.span:
SCHS Announcements - Tuesday, April 28, 2020
Musical t-shirts can be picked up Thursday 2-6 pm - HS lobby for HS students & grade school students at the Wyoming Elementary School. If you have not paid already, you can do so when you pick your shirt up.
Also ANY STUDENT that has medicine or medical supplies remaining at school, the nurses will be available on Thursday (April 30th) between 2 and 6 p.m. to return your medicine to you. Jr High and HS students can pick theirs up at the HS Gym Lobby and grade school students at the Wyoming Elementary School.
SENIORS:
Stark County Masonic Lodge Scholarship is now available. Application must be submitted via email to tdashby@me.com before Tuesday, May 12th. Mrs. McGrath sent an email to all seniors on April 25th with details. If you need a hard copy, you can pick one up in the HS gym foyer on Thursday during regular packet pick up/drop off from 2 to 6 pm. If you have questions please email Mrs. McGrath.
Also remember to complete the information needed for the yearbook. Mrs. Nelson sent each of you an email on 4/27 with details. Please email Deb Nelson at dnelson@stark100.com if you have questions. The DEADLINE is APRIL 30TH.
Reminder to check your email from Anne Snyder regarding a senior slideshow. We have created a “shell presentation” that you can fill in. We need you to complete your page no later than 3pm on May 11th, so we can format and add music. We are asking that you share: A senior quote; a baby, elementary, middle school, and senior picture; and what are your post high school plans. We will share the finished product and you can download and share with family and friends.
JUNIORS:
Better Banks in Wyoming is looking for a student worker. They are looking to hire for this summer and then carry the position through the 20-21 school year. This position will require at least some, if not every Saturday morning plus hours throughout the week. You must be in good academic standing and be willing to leave school early-maybe as early as 5th hour and work until as late as 5 p.m. This is a great opportunity for your senior year - you will get a great job experience and can earn money! Please let Mrs. McGrath know this week if you are interested so she can submit your name to the bank. (amcgrath@stark100.com)
REMINDERS:
Packet pick up/drop off - THURSDAY April 30th from 2-6 pm in the HS foyer (outside the gym).
INTERESTED IN CHEERLEADING - Please look for the email sent last week from Mr. Utsinger regarding virtual cheerleading tryouts. For more information contact Molly Carlton (309) 883-2405.
2020-2021 Registration – Registration information has been mailed. You will be able to register online. You were mailed an information sheet, fee form, Blackboard instructions to update, etc.
No Internet - Students are welcome to go to the Elementary, JH and HS parking lots to use the school WIFI. Students then can download to their chrome books the lessons to work on at home without even getting out of your comfortable car!
